trial_identification.studytitle: Randomised controlled trial of yoga for reducing depression and anxiety, and improving well-being and mental health.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomised controlled trial comparing benefits of personalised yoga interventions with waitlist treatment as usual, for reducing symptoms of depression and anxiety, and improving positive emotions, well-being and mental health.

interventions.interventions: 4 x 1 hour private yoga sessions are offered to each participant, over period of six weeks. A suitable personalised yoga practice is developed for participants to do at home, using consensus-based yoga protocol guidelines.
interventions.comparator: 6 week waitlist period, with treatment as usual (TAU). Yoga intervention is offered at end of waitlist period.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, after 6 week intervention period, and 12 week follow-up (6 weeks after intervention completion)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Mild or moderate depression or anxiety indicated by DASS score, English competency, anti-depressant/anxiety medications (including complementary) and other forms of professional assistance are stable for at least 3 months.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Serious medical conditions, injuries or surgeries; alcohol or drug abuse; already doing a personal yoga practice (average of more than once a week, over the past 3 months.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study aims to investigate the benefits of yoga in the reduction of depression and anxiety, and associated increases in positive emotions, well-being and mental health.
